name: Pegasus
abilities: Petrifying Gaze: Anyone who looks directly at her face turns instantly to stone
Serpent Hair: Living, venomous snakes that writhe and strike independently
Flight: Golden wings enable swift aerial movement
weaknesses: Mirrors: Cannot see her own reflection without petrifying herself
Indirect Vision: Can be fought by reflecting her gaze or using periphery
Mortal Body: Despite her powers, her physical form can be wounded
Emotional Vulnerability: Attachment can cloud her judgment
habitat: Solitary caves and temples, places of desolation
behavior: Victim turned protector, vengeful yet sympathetic, isolation-driven

christian.overview: Pegasus born from Medusa's death symbolizes how divine grace brings good from evil. His flight represents the soul's ascent to God.

biblicalParallels.description: Elijah taken up by horses of fire parallels Pegasus as vehicle of divine ascent.
Christ and heavenly armies on white horses evoke divine steeds.

patristicInterpretation.summary: Pegasus represents grace bringing good from evil and elevating souls toward heaven.

medievalSymbolism.bestiaryMeaning: Associated with poetic inspiration, interpreted as Holy Spirit inspiring sacred writings.
medievalSymbolism.moralLesson: Bellerophon's fall teaches humility - heaven is by divine invitation.

christian.typologicalReading: Born from Medusa's death prefigures Christ bringing life from death.
scholarlyReferences: Wind, Edgar. Pagan Mysteries in the Renaissance. 1968.
